alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 30 at 5:38PM PDT until July 30 at 10:30PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by heavy rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the Antelope Valley in Los Angeles county. * WHEN...Until 830 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall could trigger flooding of roadways and poor drainage areas, including Highway 138 between Littlerock and Pearblossom. There could be potentially dangerous flows across low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 528 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow moving thunderstorms over the eastern Antelope Valley. Roadway flooding is expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lake Los Angeles, Palmdale, Lancaster, Quartz Hill, Pearblossom, Llano, Littlerock, Lake Palmdale, Valyermo, Saddleback Butte State Park, Highway 138 between Llano and the San Bernardino County line and Desert View Highlands. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
